result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kelly M Lecloux was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations.

miscConds.notes: Pay $1700 fine plus costs. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment as determined by DOC.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to be in bars or taverns.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Defendant is required to attend the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 10/13/16.

timeConds.notes:
10 days of sentence are stayed. If Defendant attends the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 10/13/16, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to attend, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. Report forthwith.

10/18/16 Court permanently stays 10 days of previously imposed sentence based on Defendant's attendance at 10/13/16 Victim Impact Panel.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kelly M Lecloux in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Copy of Amended Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges in amended complaint, questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to counsel. Court questions whether prelim waiver has occurred, takes recess to allow Defendant time to complete form. Defendant returns with completed waiver of prelim form. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

ADDRESS INFO for Kelly M Lecloux
Current: 1360 North 12th Place, Apt. 16, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 08-02-2016)
Prior: 903 Alabama Pl. Apt 4, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant by phone.

Defendant Kelly M Lecloux in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions status. State advises of offer made to Defendant, indication that Defendant wants to accept offer but needs time to arrange Huber, wants 60 days. Court reviews bond conditions, which will continue as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kelly M Lecloux in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Kelly M Lecloux appeared by video. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 5/2/16, 10:00. Petition for Court-appointed Counsel provided to Defendant at jail.
from Amy Benoit in support of Defendant
